Billy Moore.Action: Observes a skilled Muay Thai boxer training intensely, showing awareness and interest in the sport.
Uses YABA (crack cocaine), indicating drug use and potential impairment.
Pounds a cement post with his bare fist to temper his nerves and not feel anxiety.
Brutally slams a board against his shins repeatedly, numbing himself through pain.
Paces anxiously, takes deep breaths, showing vulnerability and self-control efforts.
Smokes Yaba to calm himself, indicating reliance on drugs rather than social or emotional support.
Nindam helps Billy put on boxing gloves and they bump fists after; shows cooperation and mutual respect.
Avoids Nindam's gaze while being too high/amped.
Quickly hides his pipe and foil in a gym bag just in time when the door bangs open, showing alertness and presence of mind.
Avoids Nindam's gaze while being tied up with boxing gloves, indicating nervousness or lack of confidence.
Rushes with Nindam and Papa through a dangerous slum environment to the gym, showing determination and focus despite adverse conditions.
Enters the ring highly amped on methamphetamine, which may impair judgment but also heightens senses and adrenaline.
Sees an opening mid-round and lands a powerful hook that knocks Eckachai down, demonstrating skill and tactical awareness.
Charges wildly like a 'wild boar' with a savage two-fisted attack, showing aggression but possibly reckless fighting style.
Papa and Nindam shouting instructions to Billy, but he can't hear them due to ringing in his ears.
Storms out aggressively in round two, swinging wildly and missing.
Protests to the Ref after being counted out, despite language barrier.
Headbutts the Ref violently after the Ref shoves Nindam away.
Headbutts the Ref in a violent altercation.
Kicks and stomps the Ref with manic, uncontrollable rage.
Experiences remorse, self-hatred, and pain after the violent outburst.
Forces a smile at Nina and nods to the booth where two young Australian men wait, indicating some attempt at friendly interaction.
Counts out drugs and sells them to the Australians, pocketing the cash without apparent concern for their wellbeing.
Works the club hustling drug deals, getting higher with customers and alone, showing self-destructive behavior but no warmth toward others.
Throws water on his face and shadow-boxes morosely in front of a mirror, showing internal struggle and vulnerability.
Tries to talk to Nina despite his poor condition, showing some desire for connection.
Takes Nina by the arm and pulls her close after she rejects him, an intrusive and non-consensual action.
Counts out drugs and cash carefully, completes drug deals with apparent control and focus despite his bruised and bloodied state.
Hustles multiple drug deals while increasingly intoxicated and high, mixing drugs and alcohol, showing impaired judgment and loss of control.
Throws water on his face and shadow-boxes in front of a mirror, attempting to regain composure and focus.
Attempts to engage Nina despite his deteriorated condition, but resorts to pulling her close after rejection, showing poor social judgment and lack of respect for boundaries.
Lets Nina go after she catches the desperate pain in his eyes, showing respect for her boundaries.
Takes Nina by the arm and pulls her close despite her rejection.
Looks away in shame when the manager stares at him in horror.
Hides yaba packets by forcing them up his ass and eats others to avoid police detection.
Refuses to sign a document he cannot read despite pressure and intimidation from police.
Erupts loudly demanding to contact the embassy, showing assertiveness under duress.
Responds honestly and calmly to accusations, denying theft and drug dealing.
Refuses to sign a document he cannot read despite pressure and intimidation.
Erupts loudly demanding to contact the embassy, showing assertiveness under extreme stress.
Appears terrified and frozen initially, unable to understand the language or situation fully.

Paces anxiously in a holding cell, vomits, and frantically searches for and consumes his hidden drugs to manage withdrawal symptoms.
Watches helplessly as other addicts steal his pills, showing inability to assert control or protect his resources.
Stares in shock as a fellow prisoner is brutally beaten by a guard, showing empathy and distress.

Observes the brutal treatment of Nok with shock but does not intervene or react outwardly.
Steps up calmly to undergo the humiliating and demeaning physical exam without resistance.
Responds to Officer Pi Sit's questions calmly and honestly despite fear and nervousness.
Does not engage or attempt to connect with other Thais around him, remains silent and withdrawn.

Responds to questions with straightforward, concise answers, showing awareness of his situation.
Admits to having no family or support to send money, showing vulnerability but also honesty.
Accepts heroin from Elyias to ease his pain without protest, showing vulnerability and trust in a fellow prisoner.
Remains silent and does not engage with Officer Pi Sit beyond minimal responses, showing no friendliness or warmth.
Fights for tips rather than professionally, indicating a lack of confidence or status in boxing.

Grips the bars, on his knees, staring forlorn and numb across the yard alone, showing vulnerability and silent reflection.
